display: table-cell; white-space: nowrap; line-height: 1.5; max-width: 200px; text-align: center;
display: table-cell; white-space: nowrap; line-height: 1.5; max-width: 200px; text-align: center;

span.p:
üöÄ Starting to Scale
10-50 employees
Growing revenue
Hiring more people

div.style: display: table; white-space: break-spaces; line-height: 1.5; max-width: 200px; text-align: center; width: 200px;
display: table; white-space: break-spaces; line-height: 1.5; max-width: 200px; text-align: center; width: 200px;

span.p:
1. TECHNICAL SCALABILITY
(0-100 score)
üî¥ 0-20: Manual chaos, no APIs
üü† 21-40: Basic automation, siloed tools
üü° 41-60: API-first, event-driven emerging
üü¢ 61-80: Automation mesh, 60%+ automated
üîµ 81-100: Autonomous systems, self-healing

div.style: display: table; white-space: break-spaces; line-height: 1.5; max-width: 200px; text-align: center; width: 200px;

span.p:
2. HUMAN SCALABILITY
(0-100 score)
üî¥ 0-20: Hero culture, knowledge in heads
üü† 21-40: Some docs, still 'Ask Jane'
üü° 41-60: Playbooks exist, 3-month ramp
üü¢ 61-80: Self-service knowledge, 1-month ramp
üîµ 81-100: AI co-pilots, <2 week ramp

div.style: display: table; white-space: break-spaces; line-height: 1.5; max-width: 200px; text-align: center; width: 200px;

span.p:
3. CULTURAL SCALABILITY
(0-100 score)
üî¥ 0-20: Founder dependency, all decisions escalate
üü† 21-40: Unwritten rules, 'you had to be there'
üü° 41-60: Values documented, not fully lived
üü¢ 61-80: Values embedded, culture propagates
üîµ 81-100: Self-reinforcing culture, AI enforces values

div.style: display: table; white-space: break-spaces; line-height: 1.5; max-width: 200px; text-align: center; width: 200px;

span.p:
OVERALL SCALABILITY
(Tech + Human + Culture) / 3
0-40: High risk of hitting ceiling soon
41-60: Moderate, targeted improvements needed
61-80: Good, ready for 2-3x growth
81-100: Excellent, ready for 10x+ growth

div.style: display: table-cell; white-space: nowrap; line-height: 1.5; max-width: 200px; text-align: center;
display: table; white-space: break-spaces; line-height: 1.5; max-width: 200px; text-align: center; width: 200px;

span.p:
CEILING 1: FOUNDER BOTTLENECK
üö® Symptoms:
‚Ä¢ CEO approves all hires, deals, decisions
‚Ä¢ Team waits for founder input
‚Ä¢ Founder working 70+ hours/week
‚Ä¢ Decision velocity slows
‚úÖ Fix:
‚Ä¢ Codify decision frameworks
‚Ä¢ Delegate authority by tier
‚Ä¢ Type 1 vs Type 2 decisions
‚Ä¢ Empower managers

div.style: display: table; white-space: break-spaces; line-height: 1.5; max-width: 200px; text-align: center; width: 200px;

span.p:
CEILING 2: COMMUNICATION OVERHEAD
üö® Symptoms:
‚Ä¢ Meetings multiply (n¬≤ problem)
‚Ä¢ Information silos between teams
‚Ä¢ Context constantly re-explained
‚Ä¢ Duplicate work discovered
‚úÖ Fix:
‚Ä¢ Build shared context layer (Data Spine)
‚Ä¢ Knowledge graphs, AI assistants
‚Ä¢ Async-first communication
‚Ä¢ Cross-functional squads

div.style: display: table; white-space: break-spaces; line-height: 1.5; max-width: 200px; text-align: center; width: 200px;

span.p:
CEILING 3: KNOWLEDGE SILOS
üö® Symptoms:
‚Ä¢ Bus factor = 1 for key processes
‚Ä¢ New hires take 6+ months to ramp
‚Ä¢ Documentation outdated/unused
‚Ä¢ 'Ask [person name]' culture
‚úÖ Fix:
‚Ä¢ Externalize knowledge (playbooks)
‚Ä¢ AI assistants for self-service
‚Ä¢ Cross-train (T-shaped people)
‚Ä¢ Job rotations (20% time)

div.style: display: table; white-space: break-spaces; line-height: 1.5; max-width: 200px; text-align: center; width: 200px;

span.p:
CEILING 4: PROCESS RIGIDITY
üö® Symptoms:
‚Ä¢ Manual approval chains (5+ steps)
‚Ä¢ Processes designed for current size
‚Ä¢ Exception handling requires heroics
‚Ä¢ 'That's how we've always done it'
‚úÖ Fix:
‚Ä¢ Automate approvals (AI agents)
‚Ä¢ Self-service processes
‚Ä¢ Design for 10x scale
‚Ä¢ API-first architecture

div.style: display: table; white-space: break-spaces; line-height: 1.5; max-width: 200px; text-align: center; width: 200px;

span.p:
‚ö†Ô∏è 5 ANTI-PATTERNS TO AVOID
‚ùå Premature Scaling: Hiring aggressively before PMF
‚ùå Process Bureaucracy: Adding approval layers 'for control'
‚ùå Hero Worship: Celebrating 'saving the day' instead of systems
‚ùå Culture Neglect: 'We'll worry about culture later'
‚ùå Scaling Dysfunction: Hiring more people to fix broken processes

div.style: display: table; white-space: break-spaces; line-height: 1.5; max-width: 200px; text-align: center; width: 200px;

span.p:
‚úÖ SCALABILITY ACTION PLAN
1. Assess all 3 dimensions (use checklist)
2. Identify biggest ceiling (1-4)
3. Fix the ceiling FIRST
4. Then scale (don't scale dysfunction)
5. Monitor monthly (re-score dimensions)
üéØ Goal: All 3 dimensions >60 before 2x growth

div.style: display: table; white-space: break-spaces; line-height: 1.5; max-width: 200px; text-align: center; width: 200px;

span.p:
üéâ SUCCESSFULLY SCALED
Tech: Automation mesh operational
Human: <1 month ramp time
Culture: Self-reinforcing values
Ready for 10x growth üöÄ

div.style: display: table; white-space: break-spaces; line-height: 1.5; max-width: 200px; text-align: center; width: 200px;

span.p:
EXAMPLE: 50-person startup
Tech: 30/100 (some automation)
Human: 40/100 (docs exist, not used)
Culture: 25/100 (founder approves all)
Overall: 32/100 ‚ö†Ô∏è
Ceiling: #1 Founder Bottleneck
Fix: Delegate hiring to managers,
create decision framework

div.style: display: table; white-space: break-spaces; line-height: 1.5; max-width: 200px; text-align: center; width: 200px;

span.p:
EXAMPLE: 200-person SME
Tech: 70/100 (API-first, agents)
Human: 50/100 (3-month ramp)
Culture: 60/100 (values documented)
Overall: 60/100 ‚ö†Ô∏è
Ceiling: #2 Communication Overhead
Fix: Build Data Spine,
deploy AI assistants
